title: Phrasal Verbs With Turn And Take

questions.question: The music is too loud. Please turn it .....................
questions.description: To turn down is to lower the volume.

questions.question: My application was turned ......................... because I didn't have the required qualifications.
questions.description: To turn down an application is to reject it.

questions.question: You are required to turn ....................... the report within a couple of days.
questions.description: To turn in a report is to submit it.

questions.question: I am too tired to stay up. I think I should turn ..................... now
questions.description: To turn in is to go to bed.

questions.question: He turns .................. a monster after he has had a couple of drinks.
Don't forget to turn ..................... the fan and the lights before you leave the room.
questions.description: To turn a device off is to stop it from working.

questions.question: I had invited Samuel to my party but he didn't turn ..................
questions.description: To turn out is to attend an event.

questions.question: I hadn't seen him for years. Then one day he turned .................. at my door.
questions.description: When someone turns up, they come unexpectedly.

questions.question: If you are not happy with the service you receive, you should take it .................... with the manager.
questions.description: To take something up with somebody is to complain to them about a problem.

questions.question: I may take ..................... gardening after I retire.
questions.description: To take up something is to start doing it regularly.

questions.question: I took my wife and children ...................... to dinner yesterday.
Germany will take .................... Argentina in the first semifinal on Friday.
questions.description: To take on somebody is to compete against them.
